title: What is the difference between measurement and assessment? - Quora

response.answer_text: What are difference between assessment and measurement?” That’s a good question because many people use the words interchangeably. Although the two concepts are related, there are differences. These differences cumulatively describe the process by which different aspects of information can be obtained. Assessment and measurement have sometimes been used interchangeably, but there is a subtle difference. An assessment is a process were an evaluator obtains information via multiple procedures including formal tests, observations, clinical judgement and staff input. The focus is on obtaining some known objective or goal. Measurement in contrast refers to the testing techniques used to assess/evaluate a particular ability or set of abilities in an individual. An evaluation is also commonly associated the two concepts of assessment and measurement. An evaluation is the development and utilization of observed information and data with the primary purpose of measuring, judging and assessing the data/information and to determine outcomes and conclusions.

“ Definition of MEASUREMENT “ “MEASUREMENT | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary” A “”measurement”” is defined as meaning: “A value, discovered by measuring, that corresponds to the size, shape or quality, of something”. Or “ the act and process of measuring a figure, extent, or amount obtained by measurement of its dimension “. “ Definition of ASSESSMENT “ “ASSESSMENT | meaning in the Cambridge English Dictionary” An “”assessment”” is defined as meaning: “The act of judging or deciding the amount, value, quality, or importance of something, using the judgment and decision that is made”. Or “ the action or an instance of making a judgment about something by the act of assessing something through appraisal “. In summary A measurement is a value found by measuring somethings corresponding size, shape or quality through the act and process of measuring a figure, extent or amount obtained from its dimensions. Whereas an assessment is the act of judging or deciding the amount, value, quality, or importance of something using the action, an instance of making a judgement or the act of assessing through appraisal.
